comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
It's interesting to note that nearly all of the photos of Sir Thomas Lipton available on the internet picture him in nautical garb. That's also the way his own tea company used to portray him in advertisements, and on its packages:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/stevensnodgrass/4032162120/]

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Wystan, thanks, that's very cool to see attached to the Bain photo here.  Seen the boxes my whole life, never thought of "Lipton" being a real person before...

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Penny, I suppose it may be a matter of exposure: my wife is British, and she loves her tea. Guess who makes it for her, several times a day . . . . 
Myself, I never touch the stuff.

Wasn't Sir Tom a dashing yachtsman, though? Tall and athletic, with twinkling eyes.

comment.author: 60018481@N05
comment._content: Tommy Lipton was once asked about the cost of running a J class boat he replied "if you have to ask you can't afford it"

comment.author: 94755752@N00
comment._content: Our family has been using Lipton loose tea forever. It is actually somewhat of a challenge to find loose tea these days.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
